title: SB 1.18.3 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 26-03-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: So he said let me prepare for quitting this body by becoming Krishna conscious so therefore he surrendered himself as a disciple to Shukadeva Goswami and thus he was able to understand the actual position of the personality of God.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam, explaining how Maharaj Pariksit prepared for death by surrendering to Shukadeva Goswami and becoming Krishna conscious to understand the position of the Lord.

segments.key_quote: The personality of God Shri Krishna is known as Ajita or unconquerable and he so in every respect this word Ajita is a name of the Supreme Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the significance of the name 'Ajita' for Krishna, emphasizing that the Lord is unconquerable and cannot be understood through mere accumulation of knowledge.

segments.key_quote: But by the grace of a spiritual master like Shukadev Goswami, unto whom the king gave himself up as a most humble disciple, one is able to understand the actual position of the Lord, his eternal abode, Goloka Vrindavana, and his transcendental paraphernalia in that dharma or abode.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that understanding the Lord's abode, Goloka Vrindavana, and His paraphernalia requires the grace of a spiritual master and humble surrender, not just scholarship or speculation.

segments.key_quote: The Mayavadis, their philosophy is, God is formless, and if there is any description of kingdom of God, that is also formless.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the understanding of Goloka Vrindavana with the impersonal view of the Mayavadis and the materialistic perspective, highlighting their ignorance of spiritual reality.

segments.key_quote: If you know that you don't belong to this world, you know that you have to quit this body sometime, you know that you as spirit-soul are eternal, then what do you do about all this material paraphernalia, the material body, the material possessions, material relationship, what do you do with all that?
segments.summary: The speaker explains that realizing one's eternal nature and destination in Krishna Loka facilitates detachment from material possessions and relationships, as exemplified by Parikshit Maharaj.

segments.key_quote: From Bhagavad Gita, we understand the quality of the Lord's energy that is superior to the material quality of energy and by the grace of a bona fide spiritual master like Shukadeva Goswami, it is quite possible to know everything of the superior energy of the Lord by which the Lord manifests his eternal name, eternal quality, eternal pastimes, eternal paraphernalia and variegatedness.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that detachment from material attachments is possible by understanding the superior energy of the Lord and realizing spiritual variety, which requires the grace of a bona fide spiritual master, not just theoretical knowledge.

segments.key_quote: It is very difficult to find the Lord through Vedic literatures, but it is very easy to know the Supreme Lord by the mercy of a liberated devotee like Shukadeva Goswami. There is only way and there is no other way.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by stating that realizing the Supreme Lord is possible only through the mercy of a liberated devotee like Shukadeva Goswami, highlighting Parikshit Maharaj's fortune in meeting him.
